title: Simple Epidemic Simulation
description: A simple simulation modeling the spread of a virus in a closed population.

interactions.name: potential_infection_contact
interactions.description: An interaction between two individuals, where if one is Infected and the other is Susceptible, transmission may occur.

metrics.name: susceptible_count
metrics.description: Number of individuals in the Susceptible state over time.

metrics.name: infected_count
metrics.description: Number of individuals in the Infected state over time.

metrics.name: recovered_count
metrics.description: Number of individuals in the Recovered state over time.

metrics.name: total_cases
metrics.description: Cumulative number of individuals who have been infected.

validation_criteria.name: population_conservation
validation_criteria.description: The sum of individuals in Susceptible, Infected, and Recovered states should equal the initial population size throughout the simulation.

validation_criteria.name: valid_state_transitions
validation_criteria.description: Individuals should only transition from Susceptible to Infected, and from Infected to Recovered (no S->R, I->S, R->S, R->I transitions in this simple model).

validation_criteria.name: epidemic_curve_shape
validation_criteria.description: The 'infected_count' metric should typically show a rise, peak, and decline characteristic of an epidemic spread in a susceptible population.
